alert.note: Alert for Orange; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:41AM EST until December 18 at 10:15AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EST THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN BERGEN, PASSAIC, SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE AND ROCKLAND COUNTIES... At 941 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that heavy rain was falling across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. The Saddle River at Ridgewood is at major flood stage. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New City, Paramus, West Milford, Ridgewood, Monsey, Nanuet, Ramsey, Ringwood, Haverstraw, Pompton Lakes, Suffern, Sloatsburg, Hawthorne, Pearl River, Oradell, Bloomingdale, Pomona, Upper Greenwood Lake, Fair Lawn and Spring Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
